div.p: An element that designates an eleventh-level subordinate part of the materials.

accessrestrict, accruals, acqinfo, altformavail, appraisal, arrangement, bibliography, bioghist, c12, controlaccess, custodhist, did, fileplan, head, index, legalstatus, odd, originalsloc, otherfindaid, phystech, prefercite, processinfo, relatedmaterial, relations, scopecontent, separatedmaterial, thead, userestrict

list.label: altrender
audience
base
encodinganalog
id
lang
level
list.item: Optional (values limited to: class, collection, file, fonds, item, otherlevel, recordgrp, series, subfonds, subgrp, subseries)
list.label: otherlevel
script

div.p: Components may be either unnumbered c or numbered c01, c02,â€¦ to c12. The numbering indicates hierarchy within the endcoded finding aid, not the order of the components, so c01 in one part of a finding aid may designate a series, while in another part of the finding aid it may designate an item. Numbering components may also assist a finding aid encoder in accurately nesting components.

list.item: Use base to specify a base URI other than the URI of the EAD instance for the purpose of resolving any relative URIs contained within c11.

div.p: See the pattern for component elements in the examples under c01Component (First Level) and in fully encoded examples provided at http://www.loc.gov/ead/.
